adjectives.description: screwed (comparative more screwed, superlative most screwed)

entries.meaning: (slang, mildly vulgar) Fucked; beset with unfortunate circumstances that seem difficult or impossible to overcome; in imminent danger.
examples: They found out about our betrayal, so now we're screwed.
" […]  Did you know that my husband came home intoxicated?"Mrs. Brown laughed."Oh, not so bad as that, surely! Only a little 'screwed.' George was 'quisby,' too. But then its Christmas, you know."

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of screw
examples: He screwed the boards together tightly.
I got screwed at the swap meet yesterday.
